segments.text: I see the girl reaching up for a cookie, and she looks so hopeful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, waiting for her brother to hand her one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I remember being that excited about cookies when I was little.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like it’s nothing, even though it’s clearly about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying dishes, completely unaware of what’s going on behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a little bad for her—she’s going to be so surprised when she turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still overflowing, and now it’s reaching the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they all get their cookies before anything bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene outside the window is so peaceful, like nothing is wrong at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at the girl’s excitement, even if it’s a little risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole moment feels like a snapshot of childhood mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR
